metadata.description:
The data set contains meteorological observation data of shenshawo desert station in the middle reaches of the hehe river meteorological observation network from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014.The station is located in shensha wo, zhangye city, gansu province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point are 100.4933e, 38.7892N, and 1594m above sea level.Air temperature and relative humidity sensors are set up at 5m and 10m, facing due north.The barometer is installed at 2m;The inverted bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed sensor is set up at 5m, 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set up at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.Soil moisture sensors were buried in the ground at 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm, respectively, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil hot flow plates (3) are successively buried in the ground at 6cm.
Observation items are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:C), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: w/m), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm_1, Ms_40cm_2, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volume water content, percentage), and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: Celsius).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;Due to the adjustment of observation factors, some data were missing between 5.5-5.6, 2014.(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2014-6-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Li et al.(2013) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al.(2011) for observation data processing.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游神沙窝沙漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市神沙窝，下垫面是沙漠。观测点的经纬度是100.4933E, 38.7892N，海拔1594m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m，风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方，其中40cm在2014.5.6埋设了1个重复的土壤水分传感器（Ms_40cm_2）；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm_1、Ms_40cm_2、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于观测要素调整，在2014.5.5-5.6之间部分数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波 Bowen 比率-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行比较。

在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，当EC通量测量的潜热（LE）和显热（H）与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全时，这一任务变得更加困难。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这一温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的估计不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则是通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出的。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次航空遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可以在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测在生态水文研究中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are crucial in eco-hydrological research as they allow for the exploration and understanding of complex processes on heterogeneous surfaces. These observations are essential for addressing challenges like upscaling eco-hydrological processes and understanding interactions within oasis-desert systems. Such observations are often obtained through hierarchically nested scales and involve multidisciplinary data collection to capture comprehensive eco-hydrological dynamics.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测在生态水文研究中至关重要，因为它们允许探索和理解异质表面上的复杂过程。这些观测对于解决生态水文过程的上尺度化和理解绿洲-沙漠系统内的相互作用等挑战至关重要。这些观测通常通过分层嵌套的尺度获得，并涉及多学科的数据收集，以捕捉全面的生态水文动态。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does the term 'eddy covariance system' mean in the context of hydrometeorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，“涡度协方差系统”一词指的是一种用于测量和分析气体（如二氧化碳和水蒸气）在大气与地表之间交换的技术。该系统通过高频率记录风速和气体浓度的变化，计算出这些气体的通量，从而帮助研究者理解生态系统的碳和水循环。
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance system is a technique used in hydrometeorological data collection to measure and analyze the turbulent fluxes of energy, water vapor, and carbon dioxide between the surface and the atmosphere. It provides high-frequency data on these exchanges, which is essential for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon dynamics in various ecosystems, including oasis-desert systems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统是一种用于水文气象数据收集的技术，用于测量和分析表面与大气之间能量、水蒸气和二氧化碳的湍流通量。它提供了关于这些交换的高频数据，这对于理解各种生态系统（包括绿洲-沙漠系统）中的能量、水蒸气和碳动态至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods involving automatic meteorological stations in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 compare to those used in oasis-desert interactions during the HiWATER project?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 自动气象站的数据收集方法在黑河生态水文遥感试验中与HiWATER项目中用于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the 黑河生态水文遥感试验, data is collected using an automatic meteorological station with sensors installed at various heights and depths to measure a range of meteorological and soil parameters. This method emphasizes detailed, localized measurements at specific intervals. Conversely, the HiWATER project employs a hierarchical structure of instruments, including eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations, to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes over a larger area, focusing on oasis-desert interactions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河生态水文遥感试验中，数据通过自动气象站收集，传感器安装在不同的高度和深度，以测量一系列气象和土壤参数。这种方法强调在特定间隔内进行详细的局部测量。相反，HiWATER项目采用分层结构的仪器，包括涡度协方差塔和自动气象站，以捕捉更大区域内的多尺度生态水文过程，重点关注绿洲-沙漠相互作用。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions as discussed in the TSEB model application versus the oasis-desert areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区应用TSEB模型时，估算蒸散发面临的挑战与绿洲-沙漠地区的挑战有什么不同。
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the TSEB model application, challenges include accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas and addressing errors in component temperature separation. These errors arise from image classification and the uncertainty of derived component temperatures. In contrast, the oasis-desert areas face broader challenges such as ecological environment degradation and maintaining energy, water vapor, and carbon balance, which are compounded by the expansive and heterogeneous nature of these regions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在TSEB模型应用中，挑战包括在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域准确估计表面通量，以及解决成分温度分离中的误差。这些误差源于图像分类和衍生成分温度的不确定性。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠地区面临更广泛的挑战，如生态环境退化以及维持能量、水蒸气和碳平衡，这些问题因这些区域的广阔和异质性而加剧。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas using remote sensing and ground-based measurements?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，使用遥感和地面测量准确估计表面通量面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in these areas is challenging due to factors such as the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences, errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperature, and the strong advective environment affecting the performance of models like the TSEB model.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在这些地区，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，原因包括表面与空气温度差异的不确定性、从复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度的误差，以及强烈的平流环境对像TSEB模型等模型性能的影响。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of employing a multiscale data collection approach on understanding eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 采用多尺度数据收集方法对理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用中的生态水文过程的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Employing a multiscale data collection approach in oasis-desert interactions enables a more comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes by capturing data at various spatial and temporal scales. This approach allows for the integration of diverse data sources, such as eddy covariance towers, remote sensing, and ground-based measurements, which can improve the accuracy and reliability of modeling efforts and help address the challenges posed by the heterogeneous nature of the landscape.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 采用多尺度数据收集方法研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用，可以更全面地理解生态水文过程，因为它能够在不同的空间和时间尺度上捕获数据。这种方法允许整合多种数据源，如涡度协方差塔、遥感和地面测量，这可以提高建模工作的准确性和可靠性，并有助于应对景观异质性带来的挑战。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the use of high-resolution thermal cameras for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures affect the estimation of evapotranspiration in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层成分温度如何影响干旱地区蒸散发的估算。
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution thermal cameras for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures can significantly improve the estimation of evapotranspiration in arid regions. By accurately capturing the temperature differences between soil and vegetation components, this method enhances the performance of models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, enabling more reliable separation of evaporation and transpiration and resulting in better validation of the estimated evapotranspiration rates.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层组分温度，可以显著提高干旱地区蒸散发的估算。通过准确捕捉土壤和植被组分之间的温度差异，这种方法增强了像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的性能，使得蒸发和蒸腾的分离更加可靠，从而更好地验证估算的蒸散发率。

These observations contribute to understanding the fundamental exchange processes within these ecosystems, aiding in the development of strategies to balance oasis and desert systems, support ecological security, and achieve sustainable development goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期观测提供了重要数据，这些数据可以为可持续管理实践提供信息。这些观测有助于理解这些生态系统内的基本交换过程，帮助制定平衡绿洲和沙漠系统的策略，支持生态安全，并实现可持续发展目标。

Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective of collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data in oasis-desert systems through hierarchical instrumentation is to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, which is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，通过分层仪器收集多尺度和多学科数据的主要目标是解决在异质表面上放大生态水文过程的挑战，而这一挑战受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to have a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，量化理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas is crucial for recognizing the interactions within these systems, supporting ecological stability, and achieving sustainable development in oases. This understanding helps maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems to achieve goals like carbon peaking and neutrality.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识这些系统内的相互作用、支持生态稳定以及实现绿洲的可持续发展至关重要。这种理解有助于维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡，以实现碳达峰和碳中和等目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended outcomes of using a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型估计异质土地表面蒸散发的预期结果是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended outcomes of using a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model in estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces include better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, and achieving reliable estimates even under strongly advective conditions in irrigated agricultural areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型估算异质土地表面的蒸散发的预期结果包括：通过地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，更好地验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发，并在灌溉农业区即使在强烈的平流条件下也能获得可靠的估算。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What data collection techniques are employed to ensure accurate measurements of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，为确保能量、水蒸气和碳交换的准确测量，采用了哪些数据收集技术？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data collection techniques for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems include the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data. Additionally, automatic weather stations are used to gather hydrometeorological data such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. These measurements are taken with a 10-minute average period to ensure accuracy.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，能量、水汽和碳交换的数据收集技术包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来获取湍流通量数据。此外，自动气象站用于收集水文气象数据，如辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面。这些测量以10分钟的平均周期进行，以确保准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed in the HiWATER experiment to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: HiWATER实验中采用了哪些程序来捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的多尺度生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In the HiWATER experiment, multi-scale eco-hydrological processes are captured through a hierarchical arrangement of instruments over several intensive observation periods. This includes a sparse network to investigate oasis-desert interaction, with a superstation, eddy covariance towers, and automatic meteorological stations installed across various landscapes. Additionally, 12 airborne remote sensing missions using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers were conducted to provide comprehensive data collection.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在HiWATER实验中，通过在多个密集观测期内的层次化仪器布置捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这包括一个稀疏网络，用于研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用，安装了超级站、涡度协方差塔和自动气象站，分布在不同的景观中。此外，还进行了12次航空遥感任务，使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，以提供全面的数据收集。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are ground-based temperature measurements integrated into the TSEB model for improved estimation of evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 地面温度测量如何融入TSEB模型，以改善农业地区蒸散发的估算？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Ground-based temperature measurements are integrated into the TSEB model by using a Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera to capture soil and canopy component temperatures, which are then used as inputs to the model. The integration involves classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels, extracting directional brightness temperatures, and converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures. This approach allows for accurate separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures, which enhances the estimation of evapotranspiration in agricultural areas.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 地面温度测量通过使用Fluke Ti55热红外相机捕捉土壤和冠层组件温度，集成到TSEB模型中，这些温度随后作为模型的输入。集成过程包括将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素，提取方向性亮度温度，并将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。这种方法能够准确区分土壤和植被组件温度，从而提高农业地区蒸散发的估算精度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the collection of multiscale and multidisciplinary data in eco-hydrological studies in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文研究中能够收集多尺度和多学科的数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation, including LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, has enabled the collection of multiscale and multidisciplinary data during experiments like HiWATER.

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do the integration of thermal infrared cameras and eddy covariance systems facilitate accurate estimation of evapotranspiration and its components in agricultural areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 热红外相机与涡度协方差系统的结合如何促进农业地区蒸散发及其组成部分的准确估算。
Enablement.AnswerEn: Thermal infrared cameras are used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures, while eddy covariance systems measure turbulent fluxes. Together, they provide data that allow for the separation and accurate estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and total evapotranspiration using models like the TSEB.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 热红外相机用于测量土壤和冠层成分的温度，而涡度协方差系统则测量湍流通量。两者结合提供的数据可以通过像TSEB这样的模型分离和准确估计蒸发、蒸腾和总蒸散。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be difficulties in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测可能会面临哪些困难？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations in oasis-desert systems are challenging due to the lack of available data at different scales. Instruments need to be arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture eco-hydrological processes accurately, which involves the use of diverse and sophisticated equipment, such as eddy covariance towers and airborne remote sensing, to effectively gather data across various landscapes and scales.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，多尺度观测面临挑战，因为在不同尺度上缺乏可用数据。仪器需要以层次嵌套的方式排列，以准确捕捉生态水文过程，这涉及使用多样化和复杂的设备，如涡度协方差塔和航空遥感，以有效地在各种景观和尺度上收集数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might long-term observational datasets be crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换可能至关重要的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are essential for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange because they provide comprehensive data over extended periods, capturing seasonal and interannual variations. Such datasets help in recognizing oasis-desert interactions and are vital for supporting sustainable development and ecological stability, which are key for achieving carbon neutrality and ecological security in these regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，因为它们提供了长期的全面数据，捕捉季节性和年际变化。这些数据集有助于识别绿洲-沙漠相互作用，并对支持可持续发展和生态稳定至关重要，这对于实现这些地区的碳中和和生态安全是关键的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods in capturing the complexity of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉异质表面生态水文过程的复杂性方面有多有效？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current data collection methods, such as those used in the HiWATER experiment, involve instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. However, the progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The integration of various instruments, such as eddy covariance towers and remote sensing technologies, attempts to address these challenges by providing comprehensive datasets that include soil moisture, leaf area index, and flux observations.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，如HiWATER实验中使用的，涉及在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。然而，该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。通过整合各种仪器，如涡度协方差塔和遥感技术，试图解决这些挑战，提供包括土壤湿度、叶面积指数和通量观测在内的综合数据集。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways could data collection techniques be improved to better support the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures in models estimating evapotranspiration?
Judgmental.QuestionCn:
数据收集技术可以通过以下方式改进，以更好地支持模型中土壤和植被成分温度的分离，从而估算蒸散发：

1. 使用高分辨率遥感技术，以获取更精确的土壤和植被温度数据。
2. 结合地面观测与遥感数据，利用多源数据融合提高温度估算的准确性。
3. 引入时间序列分析，捕捉土壤和植被温度的动态变化。
4. 采用传感器网络，实时监测不同土壤和植被类型的温度变化。
5. 开发更先进的模型算法，能够更好地模拟土壤和植被之间的热交换过程。
6. 增强数据质量控制，确保收集的数据准确可靠。
7. 进行多尺度研究，考虑不同空间和时间尺度对温度分离的影响。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Data collection techniques could be improved by enhancing the accuracy of thermal infrared measurements and reducing classification errors in image processing. Using high-resolution thermal cameras and advanced image classification methods could help in accurately separating soil and vegetation component temperatures. Additionally, addressing uncertainties in radiation transmittances and considering atmospheric conditions could further refine the estimation accuracy in models like the TSEB.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集技术可以通过提高热红外测量的准确性和减少图像处理中的分类错误来改进。使用高分辨率热像仪和先进的图像分类方法可以帮助准确区分土壤和植被的温度。此外，解决辐射透过率的不确定性并考虑大气条件可以进一步提高像TSEB模型中的估计准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methodologies used for capturing meteorological and hydrological data in arid and semi-arid regions, particularly focusing on the instrumentation and spatial scales involved.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在干旱和半干旱地区捕捉气象和水文数据所使用的数据收集方法，特别关注所涉及的仪器和空间尺度。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for capturing meteorological and hydrological data in arid and semi-arid regions involve using instruments deployed on hierarchically nested scales. These include eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. Additional sensors for soil moisture, leaf area index, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing instruments like LiDAR and multi-angle thermal imagers are utilized.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，气象和水文数据的收集方法涉及在分层嵌套的尺度上部署仪器。这些仪器包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。此外，还使用土壤湿度传感器、叶面积指数传感器以及超高分辨率的航空遥感仪器，如激光雷达和多角度热成像仪。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in obtaining multiscale observations of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在绿洲-沙漠系统中获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in obtaining multiscale observations of eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of deploying instruments across varying landscapes such as sandy deserts, desert pavement, and wetlands. The need for extensive and well-coordinated instrumentation to capture these multiscale interactions also presents logistical and technical difficulties.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中获取生态水文过程的多尺度观测面临的挑战包括多尺度观测的稀缺性以及在沙漠、沙漠铺装和湿地等不同景观中部署仪器的复杂性。捕捉这些多尺度相互作用所需的广泛且协调良好的仪器布置也带来了后勤和技术上的困难。
